intro: Krascheninikovia eritrichioides, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Central Asia and the Middle East. It is a low-growing perennial herb with a rosette of silver-gray, woolly leaves that help reduce water loss. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds. It is adapted to harsh environments, thriving in sandy or rocky soils with minimal rainfall. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in desert ecosystems.
